title: High Livestock Production Index
description: In 2022, Malawi achieved a livestock production index of 190.08, indicating significant growth compared to the 2014-2016 baseline.

title: Low Patent Applications by Nonresidents
description: In 2016, Malawi recorded only 1 patent application by nonresidents, highlighting limited international patent activity.

title: High Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Secondary Education
description: In 2018, Malawi had a pupil-teacher ratio of 72.31 in secondary schools, indicating challenges in educational resource allocation.

title: Negative Transaction Costs for Remittances
description: In 2023, Malawi experienced a -49.69% average transaction cost for sending remittances, suggesting potential data anomalies or unique financial conditions.

title: Decline in Per Capita Real Income Growth
description: In 2019, Malawi's annualized growth rate in per capita real income was -6.11%, indicating economic challenges for the population.

title: Minimal Child Employment in Manufacturing
description: In 2015, only 0.07% of economically active children aged 7-14 were employed in manufacturing, reflecting low child labor rates in this sector.

title: High Part-Time Employment Rates
description: In 2020, 76.09% of Malawi's total employment was part-time, with 82.82% of females and 69.59% of males working part-time, indicating a flexible labor market.

title: Negligible Merchandise Export Residuals
description: In 2020, Malawi's merchandise export residuals were effectively zero, suggesting precise export reporting and minimal discrepancies.
